titleStmt.title: George Bliss, Jr. et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG1662

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Military Correspondence, 1863-1867

creation.placeName: New York, New York County, New York

body.p:
Heaquarters 20th and 25th Regiments, U. S. Colored Troops,
350 FOURTH STREET, NEW YORK.
Hon. His Ex T E. Bramlette
DEAR SIR:

The following petition, just presented to the U. S. Senate by the Hon. CHARLES SUMNER, of Massachusetts, and to the House of Representative by the HON. WM. D. KELLY, of Pennsylvania, is respectfully submitted for your favorable consideration.

Committee Union League Club.
GEORGE BLISS, JR.,
LE GRAND B. CANNON,
ALEXANDER VAN RENSSELAER,
JAMES A. ROOSEVELT,
CHARLES P. KIRKLAND,
SHERMAN J. BACON,
ELLIOT C. COWDIN,
JACKSON S. SCHULTZ,
EDWARD CROMWELL.
JAMES RODGERS.
TO THE HONORABLE THE SENATE AND HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES OF THE UNITED STATES:

The undersigned Citizens of New York, respectfully pray to your honorable bodies to pass such laws as will put the soldiers of our army on the same footing as to Bounty, Pay and Pensions, without regard to difference of complexion.

Anderson, Wm. T., 183 West 14th st
